problem: Simplify and write the result as a common fraction: $$\sqrt{\sqrt[3]{\sqrt{\frac{1}{4096}}}}$$
solution: First, notice that $4096=4^6$.  We can begin simplifying from the innermost square root: $$\sqrt{\sqrt[3]{\frac{1}{\sqrt{4096}}}}=\sqrt{\sqrt[3]{\frac{1}{64}}}=\sqrt{\frac{1}{4}}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{4}}=\boxed{\frac{1}{2}}$$
chatgpt_solution: First, we can simplify the fractional exponent: $$\sqrt{\sqrt[3]{\sqrt{\frac{1}{4096}}}} = \sqrt{\sqrt[3]{\left(\frac{1}{4096}\right)^\frac{1}{2}}} = \sqrt{\sqrt[3]{\frac{1}{\sqrt{4096}}}}.$$Next, we simplify the square root of the number under the cube root: $$\sqrt{\sqrt[3]{\frac{1}{\sqrt{4096}}}} = \sqrt{\sqrt[3]{\frac{1}{64}}} = \sqrt{\left(\frac{1}{64}\right)^\frac{1}{3}} = \sqrt{\frac{1}{\sqrt[3]{64}}}.$$Now we simplify the cube root: $$\sqrt{\frac{1}{\sqrt[3]{64}}} = \sqrt{\frac{1}{4}} = \boxed{\frac{1}{2}}.$$
